reviews.text: It's a Nice place to be because of the Views also the Wonderful Sea but Why is it Just Northern running the trains to Bridlington?
No time window for parking when meeting someone.
Clean and tidy station. Good parking

Bridlington railway station is on the Scarborough to Hull line with trains arriving approximately every two hours. Gents and ladies toilets are available on the station concourse and a disabled toilet and baby changing facility can be found on the platform. Access to trains for Scarborough requires the use of the footbridge. A cafe is situated near the station entrance with seating inside and outside.
It has parking, toilet, little restaurant, snack and drinks vendors machines, ticket machine (sometimes works accept cash and card and sometimes only accept card) or could get tickets from help desk.
